laboratory_examinations.findings: Initial PSA level was 240 ng/mL; decreased to 77 ng/mL after 6 weeks of treatment; further decreased to 4.6 ng/mL after radiation treatment (week 17); decreased to 0.4 ng/mL after completing antiandrogen treatment (week 35) and remained 0.4 ng/mL at week 56.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial level was 240 ng/mL; decreasing trend observed over time, showing a reduction at each checkpoint: 240 ng/mL to 77 ng/mL to 4.6 ng/mL to 0.4 ng/mL.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Total serum testosterone level was 44 ng/dL (1.5 nmol/L), consistent with expected castrate levels.
